body.p: Match the term with its definition related to the processing of a formed blood clot.

response.feedback: Correct. Breaking down blood clots is important to prevent them from growing further, which can be problematic.
Incorrect. Fibrinolysis breaks down fibrin clots (think fibrin + lysis), which are the products of coagulation.
Incorrect. Fibrinolysis breaks down fibrin clots (think fibrin + lysis), which are the products of coagulation.
Incorrect. Fibrinolysis breaks down fibrin clots (think fibrin + lysis), which are the products of coagulation.
Incorrect. Fibrinolysis breaks down fibrin clots (think fibrin + lysis), which are the products of coagulation.
Incorrect. Fibrinolysis breaks down fibrin clots (think fibrin + lysis), which are the products of coagulation.
Incorrect. The process of clot retraction causes blood clots to decrease in size over several days.
Correct. As the platelets pull on fibrin clots, it allows the edges of the vessel wall at the point of injury to come together to repair the damage.
Incorrect. The process of clot retraction causes blood clots to decrease in size over several days.
Incorrect. The process of clot retraction causes blood clots to decrease in size over several days.
Incorrect. The process of clot retraction causes blood clots to decrease in size over several days.
Incorrect. The process of clot retraction causes blood clots to decrease in size over several days.

part.hint: Think: what does it mean to “retract” a blood clot?

response.feedback: Incorrect. Kallikrein is required to cleave the inactive zymogen plasminogen to its active form of plasmin.
Incorrect. Kallikrein is required to cleave the inactive zymogen plasminogen to its active form of plasmin.
Correct. Plasminogen is released as a zymogen that needs to be cleaved by kallikrein to its active form, plasmin.
Incorrect. Kallikrein is required to cleave the inactive zymogen plasminogen to its active form of plasmin.
Incorrect. Kallikrein is required to cleave the inactive zymogen plasminogen to its active form of plasmin.
Incorrect. Kallikrein is required to cleave the inactive zymogen plasminogen to its active form of plasmin.

part.hint: Kallikrein is a protease. It is able to cleave peptide bonds in proteins.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Plasminogen is an inactive enzyme that needs to be cleaved to its active form, plasmin.
Incorrect. Plasminogen is an inactive enzyme that needs to be cleaved to its active form, plasmin.
Incorrect. Plasminogen is an inactive enzyme that needs to be cleaved to its active form, plasmin.
Correct. Plasminogen is released from the liver as a zymogen, and is eventually cleaved to its active form of plasmin.
Incorrect. Plasminogen is an inactive enzyme that needs to be cleaved to its active form, plasmin.
Incorrect. Plasminogen is an inactive enzyme that needs to be cleaved to its active form, plasmin.
Incorrect. Plasmin is a protease that digests fibrin clots.
Incorrect. Plasmin is a protease that digests fibrin clots.
Incorrect. Plasmin is a protease that digests fibrin clots.
Incorrect. Plasmin is a protease that digests fibrin clots.
Correct. The digestion of fibrin is known as fibrinolysis.
Incorrect. Plasmin is a protease that digests fibrin clots.

part.hint: Plasmin is able to degrade many blood plasma proteins.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Bradykinin results in vasodilation, lowering blood pressure.
Incorrect. Bradykinin results in vasodilation, lowering blood pressure.
Incorrect. Bradykinin results in vasodilation, lowering blood pressure.
Incorrect. Bradykinin results in vasodilation, lowering blood pressure.
Incorrect. Bradykinin results in vasodilation, lowering blood pressure.
Correct. Bradykinin results in vasodilation, lowering blood pressure.

part.hint: Bradykinin’s purpose is to lower blood pressure.
